original: Broberg, Sven Arvid Grén, fil. dr, fd. förste bibliotekarie, Göteborg, f. 8/ 12/78 i Örgryte, Gbgs o. Boh. L, av grossh. Carl B. o. Fanny Grén av Rossö. — Fil. kand. i Gbg 0i2, fil. lic. 08, fil. dr 13, organistex. 01, kyrkosång :ex. 08. Aman. v. Gbgs stadsbibi. 10, andre bibi. där 15, förste dito 30-43. Led. av styr. f. Gbgs stiftskrets av Kyrkosångens vänner fr. 11, i V. Sv:es folkbiildn :förb. 18-38, i komm. f. anordn. av folkkons. i Gbg 21-44, i Annedals arb-.stuga fr. 26, i utlandssv. muséet 28-37 m. fl. Skr.: Ormr Snor-rasons bok (Arkiv f. nord. filol. 24, 25), Rémundar saga keisarasonar (09-12), J. G. C. Cederschiölds bibliogr. (14), utg. bibliograf. arb. m. m. Hob-bies: musik, resor, fjällvandringar. RNO, ÖRKFM2kl m krgd, sjv förtj :M.
translated: Broberg, Sven Arvid Grén, PhD, former senior librarian, Gothenburg, born December 8, 1878 in Örgryte, Gothenburg and Bohus County, son of wholesaler Carl B. and Fanny Grén of Rossö. He obtained a Bachelor of Arts degree in Gothenburg in 1902, a Master of Arts degree in 1908, and a PhD in 1913. He also obtained a degree in organ playing in 1901 and in church singing in 1908. He was an assistant at the Gothenburg city library in 1910, second librarian there in 1915, and first librarian there from 1930 to 1943. He was a member of the board of directors for the Gothenburg diocese area of the Society for Church Singing Friends since 1911, in the Western Sweden People's Educational Association from 1918 to 1938, and in the committee for planning public concerts in Gothenburg from 1921 to 1944. He was also a member of the Annedals workhouse from 1926 and of the Museum of Foreign Literature in Sweden from 1928 to 1937, among others. He authored Ormr Snor-rasons Bok (Archives for Nordic Philology 24, 25), Remundar Saga Keisarasonar (09-12), J. G. C. Cederschiöld's Bibliography (14), edited bibliographic work, and more. His hobbies were music, travel, and hiking in the mountains. He was awarded the Royal Order of the North Star, the Second Class of the Order of Vasa, and the Medal of Merit, among other honors.

structured.description: Sven Arvid Grén Broberg was a Swedish senior librarian and author, born on December 8, 1878, in Örgryte, Gothenburg and Bohus County. He was the son of wholesaler Carl B. and Fanny Grén of Rossö. Broberg obtained several educational occupational credentials in Gothenburg University and achieved a PhD in 1913. He was an assistant at the Gothenburg city library in 1910, second librarian there in 1915, and first librarian there from 1930 to 1943. He was an active member of different organizations, including the Society for Church Singing Friends, the Western Sweden People's Educational Association, the Committee for Planning Public Concerts in Gothenburg, among others. Broberg authored several papers and edited bibliographic work, among others. His hobbies were music, travel, and hiking in the mountains. Broberg was awarded the Royal Order of the North Star, the Second Class of the Order of Vasa, and the Medal of Merit, among other honors.
